Subject: Re: [junit] How to write Test Cases for Jsp's
References: <20010720130558.24555.qmail@...> <3B58693C.6976A991@...> <006d01c1115f$3b1239a0$eae07bd5@gateway> <OE498zAJ95sZKxt8zPd00000c3f@...>

From: "Ramya T.V" <ramya@...>

Here are the links for HttpUnit and Cactus (of course, both are free)

http://httpunit.sourceforge.net/
http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/cactus/index.html

The Cactus framework is not a functional test framework which views your server
classes as a black box and only tests the returned results from externally
calling your application (see HttpUnit for this). Both frameworks are
complementary.

Regards,
Ramya TV

Mathieu Gervais wrote:

> >I found myself writing pages to be testable by marking up interesting bits
> of the page so I could find them. For example, if I included my error
> >messages in <span id="errorMessage"> I could just write
> >findSpansWithId("errorMessage").
>
> I use exactly this technique. I use the excellent HTTPUnit package. (with
> response.getTableWithId() ).
>
> mathieu
subject: Re: [junit] How to write Test Cases for Jsp's
